page.title: 06THE UNION CANAL
page.content:
QUITE A FEW LOCAL PEOPLE HAVE THEIR OWN SAILING CRAFT WHICH THEY USE ON THE CANAL AND SEVERAL SCHOOLS COME FROM OUTSIDE THE AREA AND USE THE CANAL AT RATHO FOR CANOEING.
ANOTHER ACTIVITY WHICH TAKES PLACE ON THE CANAL IS THE CANAL JUMPING CONTEST. THIS TAKES PLACE DURING THE RATHO GALA WEEK AND INVOLVES PEOPLE TRYING TO JUMP OVER A PART OF THE CANAL NEAR TO THE BRIDGE INN. VERY FEW PEOPLE HAVE ACTUALLY MANAGED THIS, THE MAJORITY FINISH UP IN THE WATER.
IT IS HOPED THAT IN THE FUTURE PARTS OF THE CANAL WHICH HAVE BEEN BLOCKED OFF IN THE PAST WILL BE OPENED UP AGAIN WHICH WILL ALLOW BARGES FROM RATHO TO TRAVEL MUCH GREATER DISTANCES AND ENCOURGE EVEN MORE PEOPLE TO USE ITS FACILITIES.
